sen.j: 正五位（しょうごい）とは、日本の位階及び神階における位のひとつ。
sen.e: Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) is one of the ranks in Japan's aristocratic and religious hierarchies.
Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) is one of the ranks in Japan's aristocratic and religious hierarchies.
Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) is one of the ranks in Japan's aristocratic and religious hierarchies.

sen.j: 従四位の下、従五位の上に位する。
sen.e: It is positioned under Juchii (Junior Fourth Rank) and above Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
It is positioned under Juchii (Junior Fourth Rank) and above Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
It is positioned under Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank) and above Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).

sen.j: 贈位の場合、贈正五位という。
sen.e: When conferred as a posthumous rank, it is called Zo-shogoi.
When conferred as a posthumous rank, it is called Zo-shogoi.
When conferred as a posthumous rank, it is called Zo-shogoi.
Shogoi
Shogoi
Shogoi

sen.j: 正五位は、律令制下において上下にわけられ、官位相当では主に京官、特に次官ないし判官相当の官位として充てられた。
sen.e: Shogoi is separated into senior and junior rank under the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) and conferred to bureaucrats in the ranks of Kyokan (official of the Capital), especially those equivalent to either "Suke" or "Hangan."

Shogoi was separated into senior and junior rank under the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) and conferred to bureaucrats in the ranks of Kyokan (official of the Capital), especially those equivalent to "Suke" or "Hangan."
sen.cmt: is separated をwas separatedに変更、eitherを除去
sen.e: Shogoi was separated into senior and junior rank under the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) and conferred to bureaucrats in the ranks of Kyokan (official of the Capital), especially those equivalent to "Suke" or "Hangan."

sen.j: 例えば太政官の左右中弁や小弁、八省の大輔、大判事、職の大膳大夫、近衛府の少将、衛門府、兵衛府の督などが挙げられる。
sen.e: Examples are Uchuben and Sachuben (Middle Controllers of the Right and of the Left) and Koben (Small Controllers) of the Daijokan (Grand Council of State), various Taifus (chiefs) of the Hassho (eight ministries and agencies), Daihanji (a judge), Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table) of Shiki, Shosho (Minor Captain) of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) and of Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and Captain of Konoefu.

As examples, cited are Uchuben and Sachuben (Middle Controllers of the Right and of the Left) and Koben (Small Controllers) of the Daijokan (Grand Council of State), various Taifus (chiefs) of the Hassho (eight ministries and agencies), Daihanji (a judge), Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table) of Shiki, Shosho (Minor Captain) of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), and Captain of Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and Konoefu.
sen.cmt: Examples areをAs examples, cited are に変更、 「and of Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and Captain of Konoefu」 を 「, and Captain of Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and Konoefu」 に変更。
sen.e: As examples, cited are Uchuben and Sachuben (Middle Controllers of the Right and of the Left) and Koben (Small Controllers) of the Daijokan (Grand Council of State), various Taifus (chiefs) of the Hassho (eight ministries and agencies), Daihanji (a judge), Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table) of Shiki, Shosho (Minor Captain) of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), and Captain of Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and Konoefu.

sen.j: ちなみに、ゴイサギという鳥は、平安時代にサギを正五位に叙した故事からきている。
sen.e: On a side note, the Japanese name of the black-crowned night heron "Goisagi" comes from an ancient record of the bird given the Shogoi rank in the Heian Period.
Note that the Japanese name of the black-crowned night heron "Goisagi" comes from an ancient record of the bird given the Shogoi rank in the Heian Period.
sen.cmt: On a side note, --> Note that
sen.e: Note that the Japanese name of the black-crowned night heron "Goisagi" comes from an ancient record of the bird given the Shogoi rank in the Heian Period.

sen.j: 武家においては、鎌倉時代に北条氏の一門が叙せられた他、豊臣氏の政権下における大名の官位としても叙位がなされたが、江戸時代には従四位下や従五位下の叙位が集中したため、幕藩体制の中の武家で正五位に叙せられた者は少ない。
sen.e: In the warrior class, the rank was bestowed on the Hojo family in the Kamakura Period and the daimyo lords under Toyotomo rule but rarely to the samurai under the Edo shogunate system due to concentration of rank conferral to the Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) and Jugoige (Junior Fifth Rank, Low Grade).

In the warrior class, the rank was bestowed on the Hojo family in the Kamakura Period as well as on the daimyo lords under Toyotomo rule, but rarely to the samurai under the Edo shogunate system because conferment for the sumurai at the time was centered upon Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) and Jugoige (Junior Fifth Rank, Low Grade).
sen.cmt: 表現の見直しをしました。
sen.e: In the warrior class, the rank was bestowed on the Hojo family in the Kamakura Period as well as on the daimyo lords under Toyotomo rule, but rarely to the samurai under the Edo shogunate system because conferment for the sumurai at the time was centered upon Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) and Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: Jugoige (Junior Fifth Rank, Low Grade)→Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 江戸時代の主な叙任者は宮廷の地下官人や親王家・五摂家・清華家などに仕えた諸大夫であり、朝廷関係者の専用の官位ということができる。
sen.e: The principal holders of the rank in the Edo period were Jigekanjin (officials who served as Kyokumu and Kanmu that were central bodies of low-class officials in the medieval Imperial Palace, and their subordinate Rokuinogekishi) and the Taifu who served the families of Imperial Princes, Gosekke (the five families of the Fujiwara clan whose members were eligible for the positions of Sessho and Kanpaku) and Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families), showing that the rank was bestowed exclusively to those linked to the Imperial Court.

The principal holders of the rank in the Edo period were Jigekanjin (officials who served as Kyokumu and Kanmu that were central bodies of low-class officials in the medieval Imperial Palace, and their subordinate Rokuinogekishi) and the Taifu who served the families of Imperial Princes, Gosekke (the five families of the Fujiwara clan whose members were eligible for the positions of Sessho and Kanpaku) and Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families), showing that the rank was bestowed exclusively to those linked to the Imperial Court.

The principal holders of the rank in the Edo period were Jigekanjin (officials who served as Kyokumu and Kanmu that were central bodies of low-class officials in the medieval Imperial Palace, and their subordinate Rokuinogekishi) and the Taifu who served the families of Imperial Princes, Gosekke (the five families of the Fujiwara clan whose members were eligible for the positions of Sessho and Kanpaku) and Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families), showing that the rank was bestowed exclusively to those linked to the Imperial Court.

sen.j: また例外的だが、明治維新に功労のあった志士については、主に家老職にない中堅・下級武士の者が多く追贈されている。
sen.e: In rare cases, the rank has been given as additional honor to middle-rank and lower samurai who had made major contributions during the Meiji Restoration and did not hold chief retainer status.
In rare cases, the rank was given as additional honor to middle-rank and lower samurai, not being a chief retainer, who had made major contributions to the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 表現の見直しをしました。
sen.e: In rare cases, the rank was given as additional honor to middle-rank and lower samurai, not being a chief retainer, who had made major contributions to the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 現在では、死没者に対する栄典として与えられることとなっており、大学・短期大学・高等専門学校において名誉教授の称号を受けた者、民間企業の経営者のうち秀逸な業績のある者はこの位階に叙せられる例が多い。
sen.e: Today, the title is bestowed posthumously to persons as honorific title for those who had earned the status of professor emeritus at universities, junior colleges and colleges of technology and private business entrepreneurs who made outstanding contributions.

Today, the title is bestowed posthumously to persons as a honorific title for those who earned the status of professor emeritus at universities, junior colleges and colleges of technology and for those private business entrepreneurs who made outstanding achievements.
sen.cmt: 表現の見直しをしました。
sen.e: Today, the title is bestowed posthumously to persons as a honorific title for those who earned the status of professor emeritus at universities, junior colleges and colleges of technology and for those private business entrepreneurs who made outstanding achievements.
